triples.name: Boolean network
triples.relevance: The paper studies structural controllability of Boolean networks as the primary subject of investigation.

triples.name: Controllability
triples.relevance: The paper proposes new strong structural controllability criteria and polynomial-time algorithms for Boolean networks.

triples.name: Vertex cover
triples.relevance: The minimal controllability problem is reduced from the minimum vertex cover problem, establishing NP-hardness.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Pinning control strategies are based on consensus dynamics concepts for distributed network control.

triples.name: Stability theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies stability theory concepts to analyze asymptotic stability of stochastic Boolean networks.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov-based methods are fundamental to the stability analysis approach used for stochastic Boolean networks.

triples.name: Stochastic control
triples.relevance: The paper extends controllability results to stochastic Boolean networks and distributed controller design under uncertainty.
